Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Seems to act as a signaling molecule involved in the maintenance of iron homeostasis. Seems to be required in conjunction with HFE to regulate both intestinal iron absorption and iron storage in macrophages. May also have antimicrobial activity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Highly expressed in the liver and to a much lesser extent in the heart.

Literature.Title: A new mouse liver-specific gene, encoding a protein homologous to human antimicrobial peptide hepcidin, is overexpressed during iron overload.
Literature.Author: Pigeon C, Ilyin G, Courselaud B, Leroyer P, Turlin B, Brissot P, Lor√©al O.

Literature.Author: Nicolas G, Bennoun M, Devaux I, Beaumont C, Grandchamp B, Kahn A, Vaulont S.

Literature.Title: Comparative analysis of mouse hepcidin 1 and 2 genes: evidence for different patterns of expression and co-inducibility during iron overload.
Literature.Author: Alizadeh M.,Pigeon C.,Troadec M.-B.,Courselaud B.,Ilyin G.
